    This function plots frequency data as bubble plots

    plot_comps.Rd

    This function plots frequency data as bubble plots

    Usage

    plot_comps(
  data,
  dir = NULL,
  add_save_name = NULL,
  plot = 1:2,
  add_0_ylim = TRUE,
  width = 10,
  height = 7
)

    Arguments

    data

    Data file object created by SS3LF.fn or SS3AF.fn

    dir

    Directory to save files to

    add_save_name

    Option to add text to a saved figure name. This option can be useful if creating plots across multiple species and saving them into a single folder. Default NULL.

    plot

    A vector of integers to specify which plots you would like. The default is to print both figures.

    1. bubble plot of length/age composition data by year and sex

    2. distribution by year of length/age compositions data similar to r4ss figure

    add_0_ylim

    TRUE/FALSE, option to specificy if the y-axis should start at 0 or the minimum bin in the composition data file. Default TRUE.

    width

    Numeric figure width in inches, defaults to 10

    height

    Numeric figure height in inches, defaults to 7

    Author

    Chantel Wetzel

    Examples

    if (FALSE)  plot_comps(data = LFs)

    On this page

    Developed by Chantel R. Wetzel, Kelli F. Johnson, Allan C. Hicks.
